events.title: George Frideric Handel's Messiah Debuts in Dublin
events.description: The oratorio 'Messiah' by George Frideric Handel was first performed in Dublin, Ireland.
events.significance: This event marks the premiere of one of the most famous and frequently performed choral works in Western music.

events.title: Warsaw Ghetto Uprising Begins
events.description: Jewish inhabitants of the Warsaw Ghetto in Nazi-occupied Poland began an armed rebellion against German deportation efforts.
events.significance: This was one of the first large-scale uprisings against Nazi Germany, symbolizing resistance during the Holocaust.

events.title: Apollo 13 Mission Launches
events.description: NASA launches Apollo 13 on a mission to the moon; an in-flight accident later transformed it into a mission to safely return the astronauts.
events.significance: The mission demonstrated NASA's crisis management and ingenuity, popularized by the phrase 'Houston, we have a problem.'

events.title: Henry Bliss Becomes First Person Killed in an Automobile Accident in the US
events.description: Henry H. Bliss was struck by a streetcar while exiting a taxi, becoming the first recorded automobile fatality in the United States.
events.significance: This tragedy marked the beginning of awareness regarding automobile-related traffic safety.

events.title: Battle of Prestonpans in the Jacobite Rising
events.description: The Jacobite forces under Bonnie Prince Charlie defeated the British government army near Edinburgh, Scotland.
events.significance: This early victory boosted Jacobite morale during the 1745 rising attempting to restore the Stuart monarchy.
